embed.text1: Would you want this power but

embed.title: Info
embed.description: **Would You** is a discord bot built to increase discord server activity.

Fields.name: **My Commands**
Fields.value:
`/wouldyou` - Start a discussion about random powers
`/ping` - Pong!
`/language` - Change the language of the bot for the server
`/help` - Shows this info
`/rather` - Gives you two powers to choose from
`/custom` - Sends a custom would you message in the chat!
`/wwyd` - Sends a what would you do question in the chat
`/welcome` - Add or remove the welcome channel!
`/support` - If you ever need help on the bot, use this command to get help from the support team!
Fields.privacy: We value your privacy. If you have any concerns about your data, check out privacy policy [here](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Developer-Dungeon-Studio/Would-You/main/PRIVACY-POLICY).

embed.title: Voting helps **Would You** gain more users! Make sure to vote every day!

embed.thispower: According to the vote the majority of users would want this power:

button.nocustom: There's currently no custom WouldYou messages to be displayed! Either make some or change the type using /wouldyou type

embed.nonsfw: NSFW commands aren't enabled in this server!
embed.nochannel: This command can only be used in NSFW channels!

embed.alreadytrue: This option is already on, you can turn it off by using the command and selecting `false`
embed.alreadyfalse: This option is already off, you can turn it on by using the command and selecting `true`
embed.error:
You are missing the `ManageGuild` permission!
Please contact a server administrator to change the language.

embed.title: Would You | Guide
embed.description: Guide to use the full potential of Would You
embed.name1: How to correctly use Would You!
embed.value1:
Create a dedicated channel for the bot or allow users to use the bot in the main chat. 
 > Would You's purpose is to make chats more active so it would be very ironic to deny the usage of would you in main chats. 
 > If you want to use the bot to its fullest potential, use the </welcome:1011374285350260914> command and setup a welcome channel. The channel will be used to send a would you message once a user joins.
embed.value2: > The intention behind this is to help new users be part of the conversation by giving the members a topic to talk about right after joining! This not only makes the server more active, but it also makes new users feel more included right after joining the server and encourages them to stay for longer!
embed.value3: > Yes! Make sure to talk about the topic you got instead of spamming the commands. This will help the members build a conversation and make the server more active in minutes! There is an image attached with a prime example on how to use the bot!
